page.title: 09SCHOOL ACTIVITIES
page.content: Thurnham School is a Church of England School, and the basic philosophy is a Christian one. Assembly is held on 4 days and one per week is conducted by the local clergy. Children start school in the term after their 5th birthday, and go to Junior School in the September following the 31st Aug by which time they are 7. The main subjects taught are reading, language, handwriting and mathematics. Art and craft play a large part, and the younger children spend most afternoons choosing their own play. For the older ones the lessons are more intensive. The school day is from 9am. to noon, and 1.30 to 3.30pm. with a 15 minute playtime in both sessions. A cooked lunch is provided at a cost of 60p per day, though more than half the pupils choose to bring packed lunches.
